lead_paragraph: The former Vanderbilt pitcher David Price won the Golden Spikes Award yesterday as the nation’s best amateur baseball player. Taken first in the draft by the Tampa Bay Devil Rays, Price was a finalist in 2006 for the award, given out annually by USA Baseball. Price, the first Golden Spikes Award winner from Vanderbilt, finished his junior season with an 11-1 record, a 2.63 earned run average and 194 strikeouts. He broke the team’s career strikeout record with 441 in only 3 seasons and 313 innings.
